definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.chinese: 首先，我喜欢柴可夫斯基。

sentences.english: Madame von Meck undertook to supply this security for Tschaikovsky.
sentences.chinese: 梅克夫人就致力于为柴可夫斯基提供这种安全的港口。

sentences.english: Scheps taught at the Moscow "P. I. Tschaikowsky" Conservatory.
sentences.chinese: 同时歇普斯还任教于莫斯科柴可夫斯基音乐学院。

sentences.english: Swan Lake' is one of Tchaikovsky's best-known compositions.
sentences.chinese: 《天鹅湖》是柴可夫斯基最著名的作品之一。

definition: Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Frederic Chopin or Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Borodin (name)/Alexander Borodin (1833-1887), Russian chemist and composer
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
